attributes.action: Revert the changes of early exams due to 'Ramadan'
attributes.additional_details: Please sign to revert the changes in exam timetables that are unfair and biased towards the Muslim community.
attributes.background: With just 5.02% of UK population being Muslim altering exam times is completely unjustified. Why should 95% of students have less time to revise for exams because of the 5%. As a Christian country too, I find this ridiculous.

rejection.details:
Decisions about the dates of exams are taken by exam boards, not by the UK Government or Parliament. 

You may be interested in this recent statement made by the Joint Council for Qualifications, which is a membership organisation comprising the seven largest providers of qualifications in the UK:

http://www.jcq.org.uk/media-centre/news-releases/jcq-statement---exam-timetables
